meanings.definition: The killing of animals for food.
meanings.sent1: The slaughtering of chickens on the farm was done quickly and efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The butcher shop specializes in the slaughtering of cows and pigs.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the slaughtering of vegetables for the salad was a messy job.
meanings.sent4: In the world of nature, the lion's hunting can be seen as the slaughtering of prey.
meanings.sent5: The documentary showed the brutal reality of the slaughtering process in slaughterhouses.

meanings.definition: The killing of a large number of people in a violent way.
meanings.sent1: The history books recount the slaughtering of innocent civilians during the war.
meanings.sent2: The massacre was a tragic event that led to the slaughtering of many villagers.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie depicted the slaughtering of characters in a gruesome manner.
meanings.sent4: The battle scene in the movie showed the brutal slaughtering of soldiers on both sides.
meanings.sent5: The news report covered the senseless slaughtering of victims in the city.
